1. If needed, navigate to the `recipes` repository using the command line.
1. Create a new branch called `feature`.
1. Switch to the new branch.
1. Add a new recipe to your `recipes.txt` file.
1. Stage and commit the changes to the `recipes.txt` file on the `feature` branch.
1. View the contents of `recipes.txt` to verify your changes.
1. Switch back to the default branch (`main` or `master`).
1. View the contents of `recipes.txt` again to confirm that the previous changes do not exist on the default branch.
1. Merge the `feature` branch into your default branch.
1. Delete the `feature` branch.
1. View the contents of `recipes.txt` yet again to confirm that the previous changes have been merged into the default branch.
